alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the dialkyl ether functional group, with the formula ROR', where R and R' are aryl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Diarylethers

alternative_parents.description: Organofluorine compounds that contain a benzene ring substituted with one or more trifluoromethyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Trifluoromethylbenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carboxylic acid substituent attached to a benzene ring.
alternative_parents.name: Benzoic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a nitrobenzene moiety, which consists of a benzene ring with a carbon bearing a nitro group.
alternative_parents.name: Nitrobenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds contaning a phenoxy group.
alternative_parents.name: Phenoxy compounds

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing an ether group substituted with a benzene ring.
alternative_parents.name: Phenol ethers

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an acyl moiety of benzoic acid with the formula (C6H5CO-).
alternative_parents.name: Benzoyl derivatives

alternative_parents.description: C-nitro compounds where the nitro group is C-substituted with an aromatic group.
alternative_parents.name: Nitroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing one or more chlorine atoms attached to a benzene moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Chlorobenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acyl chloride functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl chlorides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing the sulfonyl group, with the general structure RS(=O)2R' ( R,R' must not be H).
alternative_parents.name: Sulfonyls

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a sulfonic acid or derivative, with the general structure RS(=O)2X (R=alkyl, aryl; X=any heteroatom).
alternative_parents.name: Organosulfonic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure  X#N+-Z- <-> X-=N+=Z <-> X-=N-Z+ <-> X-N=Z (X = C or O, Z = C, N, or O).
alternative_parents.name: Propargyl-type 1,3-dipolar organic compounds

alternative_parents.description: 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure X:-C=Z<-> X+=C-Z- (X = C or N; Z = C, N, or O).
alternative_parents.name: Carbene-type 1,3-dipolar compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid group with the formula -C(=O)OH or a derivative thereof.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing metals and halogens. Some are ionic while others are covalently bonded.
alternative_parents.name: Organic metal halides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds comprising the oxoazanium cation, with the formula N+=O.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxoazanium compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a fluorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organofluorides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic neutral compounds having formal unit electrical charges of opposite sign.
alternative_parents.name: Organic zwitterions

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a sodium ion.
alternative_parents.name: Organic sodium salts

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl fluoride functional group with formula R-F , where R is an alkyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl fluorides

class.description: Aromatic compounds containing one monocyclic ring system consisting of benzene.
class.name: Benzene and substituted derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as diphenylethers. These are aromatic compounds containing two benzene rings linked to each other through an ether group.

direct_parent.description: Aromatic compounds containing two benzene rings linked to each other through an ether group.
direct_parent.name: Diphenylethers

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Aromatic compounds containing two benzene rings linked to each other through an ether group.
subclass.name: Diphenylethers

superclass.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
superclass.name: Benzenoids
